result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andy L Burrell-Woods

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andy L Burrell-Woods in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Andy L Burrell-Woods.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defense requests Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andy L Burrell-Woods appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Andy L Burrell-Woods.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that  due to lower pending matters, this case had been re-assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
